page.title: 06Farming in Great Chart.
page.content: In the Great Chart 'D' Block fifty per cent of the land is used for farming. The size of farm varies from 300 to 700 acres.Most of them are farmed extensively,that is,with few men and many machines.The farms are a mixture of arable and animal.The crops include wheat,barley,rape,oats,potatoes and peas,most of which are grown for cash crops.Both dairy and beef cattle are reared.Sheep farming in Great Chart is small.The soil types in the area are very variable and the area around the Great Stour is liable to flooding.The farms in the area are affected by the spread of urban development and the new by-pass and some damage is done by walkers trespassing on the land.
